pli-tv-pvr11:1.1: There are four kinds of legal issues:
pli-tv-pvr11:1.2: legal issues arising from disputes, legal issues arising from accusations, legal issues arising from offenses, legal issues arising from business.
pli-tv-pvr11:2.1: How many reopenings are there of these four legal questions?
pli-tv-pvr11:2.3: There are two reopenings of legal issues arising from disputes, four of legal issues arising from accusations, three of legal issues arising from offenses, and one of legal issues arising from business.
pli-tv-pvr11:3.1: When reopening a legal issue arising from a dispute, how many principles for settling it does one reopen?
pli-tv-pvr11:3.2: When reopening a legal issue arising from an accusation, how many principles for settling it does one reopen?
pli-tv-pvr11:3.3: When reopening a legal issue arising from an offense, how many principles for settling it does one reopen?
pli-tv-pvr11:3.4: When reopening a legal issue arising from business, how many principles for settling it does one reopen?
pli-tv-pvr11:4.1: When reopening a legal issue arising from a dispute, one reopens two principles for settling it.
pli-tv-pvr11:4.2: When reopening a legal issue arising from an accusation, one reopens two principles for settling it.
pli-tv-pvr11:4.3: When reopening a legal issue arising from an offense, one reopens two principles for settling it.
pli-tv-pvr11:4.4: When reopening a legal issue arising from business, one reopens two principles for settling it.
pli-tv-pvr11:5.1: How many kinds of reopening are there?
pli-tv-pvr11:5.2: In how many ways does a reopening come about?
pli-tv-pvr11:5.3: How many qualities do people who reopen legal issues have?
pli-tv-pvr11:5.4: How many kinds of people commit an offense when they reopen a legal issue?
pli-tv-pvr11:6.1: There are twelve kinds of reopening.
pli-tv-pvr11:6.2: A reopening comes about in ten ways.
pli-tv-pvr11:6.3: People who have four qualities reopen legal issues.
pli-tv-pvr11:6.4: There are four kinds of people who commit an offense when they reopen legal issues.
pli-tv-pvr11:7.1: What are the twelve kinds of reopening?
pli-tv-pvr11:7.2: The legal procedure hasn’t been done; it’s been done badly; it should be done again; it’s not been settled; it’s been badly settled; it should be settled again; it’s not been decided; it’s been badly decided; it should be decided again; it’s not been resolved; it’s been badly resolved; it should be resolved again.
pli-tv-pvr11:8.1: What are the ten ways that a reopening comes about?
pli-tv-pvr11:8.2: One reopens a legal issue where it arose; one reopens a legal issue where it arose and was resolved; one reopens a legal issue while traveling; one reopens a legal issue that was resolved while traveling; one reopens a legal issue after going there; one reopens a legal issue that was resolved after going there; one reopens a resolution by recollection; one reopens a resolution because of past insanity; one reopens a decision on giving a further penalty; one reopens a decision of covering over, as if with grass.
pli-tv-pvr11:9.1: What are the four qualities that people who reopen legal issues have?
pli-tv-pvr11:9.2: they reopen legal issues swayed by desire, ill will, confusion, or fear.
pli-tv-pvr11:10.1: Who are the four kinds of people who commit an offense when they reopen a legal issue?
pli-tv-pvr11:10.2: If one who was ordained on that very day does the reopening, they commit an offense entailing confession; if one who has newly arrived does the reopening, they commit an offense entailing confession; if the original doer does the reopening, they commit an offense entailing confession; if one who has given their consent does the reopening, they commit an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr11:11.0: 2. The sources of the legal issues, etc.
pli-tv-pvr11:11.1: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of legal questions arsing from disputes?
pli-tv-pvr11:11.2: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of legal questions arsing from accusations?
pli-tv-pvr11:11.3: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of legal questions arsing from offenses?
pli-tv-pvr11:11.4: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of legal questions arsing from business?
pli-tv-pvr11:12.1: Legal questions arsing from disputes have disputes as their source, their origin, their birth, their arising, their production, their origination.
pli-tv-pvr11:12.2: Legal questions arsing from accusations have accusations as their source, their origin, their birth, their arising, their production, their origination.
pli-tv-pvr11:12.3: Legal questions arsing from offenses have offenses as their source, their origin, their birth, their arising, their production, their origination.
pli-tv-pvr11:12.4: Legal questions arsing from business have business as their source, their origin, their birth, their arising, their production, their origination.
pli-tv-pvr11:13.1: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of legal questions arsing from disputes?
pli-tv-pvr11:13.2: … of legal questions arsing from accusations?
pli-tv-pvr11:13.3: … of legal questions arsing from offenses?
pli-tv-pvr11:13.4: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of legal questions arsing from business?
pli-tv-pvr11:14.1: Legal questions arsing from disputes have causes as their source, their origin, their birth, their arising, their production, their origination.
pli-tv-pvr11:14.4: Legal questions arsing from business have causes as their source, their origin, their birth, their arising, their production, their origination.
pli-tv-pvr11:15.1: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of legal questions arsing from disputes?
pli-tv-pvr11:15.2: … of legal questions arsing from accusations?
pli-tv-pvr11:15.3: … of legal questions arsing from offenses?
pli-tv-pvr11:15.4: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of legal questions arsing from business?
pli-tv-pvr11:16.1: Legal questions arsing from disputes have conditions as their source, their origin, their birth, their arising, their production, their origination.
pli-tv-pvr11:16.4: Legal questions arsing from business have conditions as their source, their origin, their birth, their arising, their production, their origination.
pli-tv-pvr11:17.0: 3. The roots of legal issues, etc.
pli-tv-pvr11:17.1: How many roots do the four kinds of legal issues have, how many origins?
pli-tv-pvr11:17.2: They have thirty-three roots, thirty-three origins.
pli-tv-pvr11:18.2: Legal questions arsing from disputes have twelve roots; legal questions arsing from accusations have fourteen roots; legal questions arsing from offenses have six roots; legal questions arsing from business have one root, the Sangha.
pli-tv-pvr11:19.2: Legal questions arsing from disputes originate from the eighteen bases for schism; legal questions arsing from accusations originate from the four kinds of failure; legal questions arsing from offenses originate from the seven classes of offenses; legal questions arsing from business originate from the four kinds of legal procedures.
pli-tv-pvr11:20.1: Is a legal issue arising from a dispute an offense or not an offense?
pli-tv-pvr11:20.3: Is it possible to commit an offense because of a legal issue arising from a dispute?
pli-tv-pvr11:20.5: How many offences does one commit because of legal questions arising from disputes?
pli-tv-pvr11:20.7: there is an offense entailing confession for abusing one who is fully ordained;
pli-tv-pvr11:20.8: there is an offense of wrong conduct for abusing one who is not fully ordained.
pli-tv-pvr11:21.1: When it comes to these offenses, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong?
pli-tv-pvr11:21.2: To which of the four kinds of legal issues do they belong?
pli-tv-pvr11:21.3: In how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found?
pli-tv-pvr11:21.4: Through how many of the six kinds of origins of offenses do they originate?
pli-tv-pvr11:21.5: Through how many kinds of legal issues, in how many places, and through how many of the ways of settling legal issues are they settled?
pli-tv-pvr11:22.1: They belong to one kind of failure:
pli-tv-pvr11:22.3: They are legal issues arising from an offense.
pli-tv-pvr11:22.4: They are found in two classes of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr11:22.5: they may be in the class of offenses entailing confession; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr11:22.7: They are settled through one kind of legal issues:
pli-tv-pvr11:22.9: They are settled in three places:
pli-tv-pvr11:22.10: in the midst of the Sangha, in the midst of a group, or in the presence of an individual.
pli-tv-pvr11:22.11: They are settled in three ways:
pli-tv-pvr11:22.12: they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over, as if with grass.
pli-tv-pvr11:23.1: Is a legal issue arising from an accusation an offense or not an offense?
pli-tv-pvr11:23.3: Is it possible to commit an offense because of a legal issue arising from an accusation?
pli-tv-pvr11:23.5: How many offences does one commit because of legal questions arising from accusation?
pli-tv-pvr11:23.7: there is an offense entailing suspension for groundlessly charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr11:23.8: there is an offense entailing confession for groundlessly charging someone with an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr11:23.9: there is an offense of wrong conduct for groundlessly charging someone with failure in conduct.
pli-tv-pvr11:24.1: When it comes to these offenses, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong?
pli-tv-pvr11:24.2: To which of the four kinds of legal issues do they belong?
pli-tv-pvr11:24.3: In how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found?
pli-tv-pvr11:24.4: Through how many of the six kinds of origins of offenses do they originate?
pli-tv-pvr11:24.5: Through how many kinds of legal issues, in how many places, and through how many of the ways of settling legal issues are they settled?
pli-tv-pvr11:25.1: They belong to two kinds of failure:
pli-tv-pvr11:25.2: they may be failure in morality; they may be failure in conduct.
pli-tv-pvr11:25.3: They are legal issues arising from an offense.
pli-tv-pvr11:25.4: They are found in three classes of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr11:25.5: they may be in the class of offenses entailing suspension; they may be in the class of offenses entailing confession; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr11:25.7: The heavy offenses are settled through one kind of legal issues:
pli-tv-pvr11:25.9: They are settled in one way:
pli-tv-pvr11:25.10: in the midst of the Sangha.
pli-tv-pvr11:25.11: They are settled through two ways:
pli-tv-pvr11:25.12: by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted.
pli-tv-pvr11:25.13: The light offenses are settled through one kind of legal issues:
pli-tv-pvr11:25.15: They are settled in three places:
pli-tv-pvr11:25.16: in the midst of the Sangha, in the midst of a group, or in the presence of an individual.
pli-tv-pvr11:25.17: They are settled in three ways:
pli-tv-pvr11:25.18: they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over, as if with grass.
pli-tv-pvr11:26.1: Is a legal issue arising from an offense an offense or not an offense?
pli-tv-pvr11:26.3: Is it possible to commit an offense because of a legal issue arising from an offense?
pli-tv-pvr11:26.5: How many offenses does one commit because of legal issues arising from offenses?
pli-tv-pvr11:26.7: there is an offense involving expulsion for a nun who knowingly conceals an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr11:26.8: there is a serious offense for concealing it if she is unsure;
pli-tv-pvr11:26.9: there is an offense entailing confession for a monk who conceals an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr11:26.10: there is an offense of wrong conduct for concealing a failure in conduct.
pli-tv-pvr11:27.1: When it comes to these offenses, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong?
pli-tv-pvr11:27.2: To which of the four kinds of legal issues do they belong?
pli-tv-pvr11:27.3: In how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found?
pli-tv-pvr11:27.4: Through how many of the six kinds of origins of offenses do they originate?
pli-tv-pvr11:27.5: Through how many kinds of legal issues, in how many places, and through how many of the ways of settling legal issues are they settled?
pli-tv-pvr11:28.1: They belong to two kinds of failure:
pli-tv-pvr11:28.2: they may be failure in morality; they may be failure in conduct.
pli-tv-pvr11:28.3: They are legal issues arising from an offense.
pli-tv-pvr11:28.5: They are found in four classes of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr11:28.6: they may be in the class of offenses entailing expulsion; they may be in the class of serious offenses; they may be in the class of offenses entailing confession; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr11:28.9: The incurable offenses are not settled by any kind of legal issue, in any place, or through any of the ways of settling legal issues.
pli-tv-pvr11:28.10: The light offenses are settled through one kind of legal issues:
pli-tv-pvr11:28.12: They are settled in three places:
pli-tv-pvr11:28.13: in the midst of the Sangha, in the midst of a group, or in the presence of an individual.
pli-tv-pvr11:28.14: They are settled in three ways:
pli-tv-pvr11:28.15: they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over, as if with grass.
pli-tv-pvr11:29.1: Is a legal issue arising from business an offense or not an offense?
pli-tv-pvr11:29.3: Is it possible to commit an offense because of a legal issue arising from an accusation?
pli-tv-pvr11:29.5: How many offenses does one commit because of legal issues arising from business?
pli-tv-pvr11:29.7: there is an offense of wrong conduct after the motion when a nun takes sides with one who has been ejected and she does not stop when pressed up to the third time;
pli-tv-pvr11:29.8: there is a serious offense after each of the first two announcements;
pli-tv-pvr11:29.9: there is an offense entailing expulsion when the last announcement is finished;
pli-tv-pvr11:29.10: there is an offense entailing suspension when monks who side with a monk who is pursuing schism do not stop when pressed up to the third time;
pli-tv-pvr11:29.11: there is an offense entailing confession when not giving up a bad view after being pressed up to the third time.
pli-tv-pvr11:30.1: When it comes to these offenses, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong?
pli-tv-pvr11:30.2: To which of the four kinds of legal issues do they belong?
pli-tv-pvr11:30.3: In how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found?
pli-tv-pvr11:30.4: Through how many of the six kinds of origins of offenses do they originate?
pli-tv-pvr11:30.5: Through how many kinds of legal issues, in how many places, and through how many of the ways of settling legal issues are they settled?
pli-tv-pvr11:31.1: They belong to two kinds of failure:
pli-tv-pvr11:31.2: they may be failure in morality; they may be failure in conduct.
pli-tv-pvr11:31.3: They are legal issues arising from an offense.
pli-tv-pvr11:31.5: They are found in five classes of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr11:31.6: they may be in the class of offenses entailing expulsion; they may be in the class of offenses entailing suspension; they may be in the class of serious offenses; they may be in the class of offenses entailing confession; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr11:31.9: The incurable offenses are not settled by any kind of legal issue, in any place, or through any of the ways of settling legal issues.
pli-tv-pvr11:31.10: The heavy offense is settled through one kind of legal issue:
pli-tv-pvr11:31.11: a legal issue arising from business.
pli-tv-pvr11:31.12: It is settled in one place:
pli-tv-pvr11:31.13: in the midst of the Sangha.
pli-tv-pvr11:31.14: They are settled in two ways:
pli-tv-pvr11:31.15: by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted.
pli-tv-pvr11:31.16: The light offenses are settled through one kind of legal issues:
pli-tv-pvr11:31.18: They are settled in three places:
pli-tv-pvr11:31.19: in the midst of the Sangha, in the midst of a group, or in the presence of an individual.
pli-tv-pvr11:31.20: They are settled in three ways:
pli-tv-pvr11:31.21: they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over, as if with grass.
pli-tv-pvr11:32.1: (1) Is a legal issue arising from a dispute a legal issue arising from an accusation, a legal issue arising from an offense, or a legal issue arising from business?
pli-tv-pvr11:32.2: A legal issue arising from a dispute is neither a legal issue arising from an accusation, nor a legal issue arising from an offense, nor a legal issue arising from business.
pli-tv-pvr11:32.3: Nevertheless, because of a legal issue arising from a dispute, there is legal issue arising from an accusation, a legal issue arising from an offense, and a legal issue arising from business.
pli-tv-pvr11:32.5: It may be that monks are disputing, saying,
pli-tv-pvr11:32.6: ‘This is the Teaching’, ‘This is not the Teaching’ …
pli-tv-pvr11:32.7: ‘This is a grave offense’, ‘This is a minor offense.’
pli-tv-pvr11:32.8: In regard to this, whatever quarreling, arguing, conflict, disputing, variety in opinion, difference in opinion, heated speech, or strife there is, this called a legal issue arsing from a dispute.
pli-tv-pvr11:32.9: When, during a legal issue arising from a dispute, the Sangha disputes, there is a legal issue arising from a dispute.
pli-tv-pvr11:32.10: When one who is disputing makes an accusation, there is an legal issue arising from an accusation.
pli-tv-pvr11:32.11: When one who is accusing commits an offense, there is a legal issue arising from an offense.
pli-tv-pvr11:32.12: When the Sangha does a legal procedure because of that offense, there is a legal issue arising from business.
pli-tv-pvr11:32.13: In this way, a legal issue arising from a dispute is a legal issue arising from an accusation, a legal issue arising from an offense, and a legal issue arising from business.
pli-tv-pvr11:33.1: (2) Is a legal issue arising from an accusation a legal issue arising from an offense, a legal issue arising from business, or legal issue arising from a dispute?
pli-tv-pvr11:33.2: A legal issue arising from an accusation is neither a legal issue arising from an offense, nor a legal issue arising from business, nor a legal issue arising from a dispute.
pli-tv-pvr11:33.3: Nevertheless, because of a legal issue arising from an accusation, there is a legal issue arising from an offense, a legal issue arising from business, and a legal issue arising from a dispute.
pli-tv-pvr11:33.5: It may be that the monks accuse a monk of failure in morality, failure in conduct, failure in view, or failure in livelihood.
pli-tv-pvr11:33.6: In regard to this, whatever accusation, accusing, allegation, blame, taking sides because of friendship, taking part in the accusation, or supporting the accusation there is, this is called a legal issue arising from an accusation.
pli-tv-pvr11:33.7: When, during a legal issue arising from an accusation, the Sangha disputes, there is a legal issue arising from a dispute.
pli-tv-pvr11:33.8: When one who is disputing makes an accusation, there is an legal issue arising from an accusation.
pli-tv-pvr11:33.9: When one who is accusing commits an offense, there is a legal issue arising from an offense.
pli-tv-pvr11:33.10: When the Sangha does a legal procedure because of that offense, there is a legal issue arising from business.
pli-tv-pvr11:33.11: In this way, a legal issue arising from an accusation is a legal issue arising from an offense, a legal issue arising from business, and a legal issue arising from a dispute.
pli-tv-pvr11:34.1: (3) Is a legal issue arising from an offense a legal issue arising from business, a legal issue arising from a dispute, or a legal issue arising from an accusation?
pli-tv-pvr11:34.2: A legal issue arising from an offense is neither a legal issue arising from business, nor a legal issue arising from a dispute, nor a legal issue arising from an accusation.
pli-tv-pvr11:34.3: Nevertheless, because of a legal issue arising from an offense, there is a legal issue arising from business, a legal issue arising from a dispute, and a legal issue arising from an accusation.
pli-tv-pvr11:34.5: There are legal issues arising from offenses because of the five classes of offenses, and there are legal issues arising from offenses because of the seven classes of offenses—these are called legal issues arising from offenses.
pli-tv-pvr11:34.6: When, during a legal issue arising from an offense, the Sangha disputes, there is a legal issue arising from a dispute.
pli-tv-pvr11:34.7: When one who is disputing makes an accusation, there is an legal issue arising from an accusation.
pli-tv-pvr11:34.8: When one who is accusing commits an offense, there is a legal issue arising from an offense.
pli-tv-pvr11:34.9: When the Sangha does a legal procedure because of that offense, there is a legal issue arising from business.
pli-tv-pvr11:34.10: In this way, a legal issue arising from an offense is a legal issue arising from business, a legal issue arising from a dispute, and a legal issue arising from an accusation.
pli-tv-pvr11:35.1: (4) Is a legal issue arising from business a legal issue arising from a dispute, a legal issue arising from an accusation, or a legal issue arising from an offense?
pli-tv-pvr11:35.2: A legal issue arising from business is neither a legal issue arising from a dispute, nor a legal issue arising from an accusation, nor a legal issue arising from an offense.
pli-tv-pvr11:35.3: Nevertheless, because of a legal issue arising from business, there is a legal issue arising from a dispute, a legal issue arising from an accusation, and a legal issue arising from an offense.
pli-tv-pvr11:35.5: Whatever is the duty or the business of the Sangha—a legal procedure consisting of getting permission, a legal procedure consisting of one motion, a legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement, a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements—this is called a legal issue arising from business.
pli-tv-pvr11:35.6: When, during a legal issue arising from business, the Sangha disputes, there is a legal issue arising from a dispute.
pli-tv-pvr11:35.7: When one who is disputing makes an accusation, there is an legal issue arising from an accusation.
pli-tv-pvr11:35.8: When one who is accusing commits an offense, there is a legal issue arising from an offense.
pli-tv-pvr11:35.9: When the Sangha does a legal procedure because of that offense, there is a legal issue arising from business.
pli-tv-pvr11:35.10: In this way, a legal issue arising from business is a legal issue arising from a dispute, a legal issue arising from an accusation, and a legal issue arising from an offense.
pli-tv-pvr11:36.1: When there is resolution by recollection, is there also resolution face-to-face?
pli-tv-pvr11:36.2: When there is resolution face-to-face, is there also resolution by recollection?
pli-tv-pvr11:36.3: When there is resolution because of past insanity, is there also resolution face-to-face?
pli-tv-pvr11:36.4: When there is resolution face-to-face, is there also resolution because of past insanity?
pli-tv-pvr11:36.5: When there is acting according to what has been admitted, is there also resolution face-to-face?
pli-tv-pvr11:36.6: When there is resolution face-to-face, is there also acting according to what has been admitted?
pli-tv-pvr11:36.7: When there is a majority decision, is there also resolution face-to-face?
pli-tv-pvr11:36.8: When there is resolution face-to-face, is there also a majority decision?
pli-tv-pvr11:36.9: When there is a further penalty, is there also resolution face-to-face?
pli-tv-pvr11:36.10: When there is resolution face-to-face, is there also a further penalty?
pli-tv-pvr11:36.11: When there is covering over as if with grass, is there also resolution face-to-face?
pli-tv-pvr11:36.12: When there is resolution face-to-face, is there also covering over as if with grass?
pli-tv-pvr11:37.1: There may be an occasion when a legal issue is resolved by resolution face-to-face and resolution by recollection.
pli-tv-pvr11:37.2: Then, when there is resolution by recollection there is also resolution face-to-face, and when there is resolution face-to-face there also resolution by recollection; but there is not resolution because of past insanity, nor acting according to what has been admitted, nor a majority decision, nor a further penalty, nor covering over as if with grass.
pli-tv-pvr11:37.3: There may be an occasion when a legal issue is resolved by resolution face-to-face and resolution because of past insanity. …
pli-tv-pvr11:37.4: by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted …
pli-tv-pvr11:37.5: by resolution face-to-face and by majority decision. …
pli-tv-pvr11:37.6: by resolution face-to-face and by further penalty …
pli-tv-pvr11:37.7: when a legal issue is resolved by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass.
pli-tv-pvr11:37.8: Then, when there is covering over as if with grass there is also resolution face-to-face, and when there is resolution face-to-face there also covering over as if with grass; but there is not resolution through recollection, nor resolution because of past insanity, nor acting according to what has been admitted, nor a majority decision, nor a further penalty.
pli-tv-pvr11:38.1: “Verdict in the presence of” or “verdict of innocence”—
pli-tv-pvr11:38.2: are these things associated or dissociated,
pli-tv-pvr11:38.3: and is it possible having analysed these things again and again, to point to a difference between them?
pli-tv-pvr11:38.4: “Verdict in the presence of” or “verdict of past insanity” …
pli-tv-pvr11:38.8: “Verdict in the presence of” or “covering over (as) with grass”—
pli-tv-pvr11:38.10: and is it possible, having analysed these things again and again, to point to a difference between them?
pli-tv-pvr11:39.1: “Verdict in the presence of” or “verdict of innocence”—
pli-tv-pvr11:39.2: these things are associated, not dissociated,
pli-tv-pvr11:39.3: and it is not possible, having analysed these things again and again, to point to a difference between them.
pli-tv-pvr11:39.4: “Verdict in the presence of” or “verdict of past insanity” …
pli-tv-pvr11:39.8: “Verdict in the presence of” or “covering over (as) with grass”—
pli-tv-pvr11:39.9: these things are associated, not dissociated,
pli-tv-pvr11:39.10: and it is not possible, having analysed these things again and again, to point to a difference between them.
pli-tv-pvr11:40.1: What is the provenance, what the arising, what the birth, what the source, what the bringing forth, what the origin of a verdict in the presence of?
pli-tv-pvr11:40.2: What is the provenance … of a verdict of innocence …
pli-tv-pvr11:40.7: of a covering over (as) with grass?
pli-tv-pvr11:41.1: A verdict in the presence of has provenance as provenance, provenance as arising, provenance as birth … source … bringing forth, provenance as origin.
pli-tv-pvr11:41.7: a covering over (as) with grass has provenance as provenance, provenance as arising … provenance as origin.
pli-tv-pvr11:42.1: What is the provenance … what the origin of a verdict in the presence of …
pli-tv-pvr11:43.1: A verdict in the presence of has cause as provenance …
pli-tv-pvr11:43.7: a covering over (as) with grass has cause as provenance … cause as origin.
pli-tv-pvr11:44.1: What is the provenance … what the origin of a verdict in the presence of …
pli-tv-pvr11:44.8: A verdict in the presence of has condition as provenance …
pli-tv-pvr11:44.14: a covering over (as) with grass has condition as provenance … condition as origin.
pli-tv-pvr11:45.1: Of the seven decidings how many roots, how many origins?
pli-tv-pvr11:45.2: Of the seven decidings there are twenty-six roots, thirty-six origins.
pli-tv-pvr11:45.3: What are the twenty-six roots of the seven decidings?
pli-tv-pvr11:45.4: Four roots of a verdict in the presence of:
pli-tv-pvr11:45.5: the presence of an Order, the presence of a rule, the presence of Discipline, the presence of the individual.
pli-tv-pvr11:45.6: Four roots of a verdict of innocence.
pli-tv-pvr11:45.7: Four roots of a verdict of past insanity.
pli-tv-pvr11:45.8: Two roots of carrying out on (his) acknowledgement:
pli-tv-pvr11:45.9: he who confesses and he to whom he confesses.
pli-tv-pvr11:45.10: Four roots of a decision of the majority.
pli-tv-pvr11:45.11: Four roots of a decision for specific depravity.
pli-tv-pvr11:45.12: Four roots of a covering over (as) with grass:
pli-tv-pvr11:45.13: the presence of an Order … the presence of the individual.
pli-tv-pvr11:45.14: These are the twenty-six roots of the seven decidings.
pli-tv-pvr11:46.1: What are the thirty-six origins of the seven decidings?
pli-tv-pvr11:46.2: Of a verdict of innocence there is the carrying out of, the performance of, the undertaking of, the assenting to, the acceptance of, the non-protesting against the formal act.
pli-tv-pvr11:46.3: Of a verdict of past insanity,
pli-tv-pvr11:46.4: of a carrying out on his acknowledgement,
pli-tv-pvr11:46.5: of a decision of the majority,
pli-tv-pvr11:46.6: of a decision for specific depravity,
pli-tv-pvr11:46.7: of a covering over (as) with grass there is the carrying out of … the non-protesting against the formal act.
pli-tv-pvr11:46.8: These are the thirty-six origins of the seven decidings.
pli-tv-pvr11:47.1: “Verdict in the presence of” or “verdict of innocence”—
pli-tv-pvr11:47.2: are these things different in meaning and different in connotation, or are they one in meaning and different only in connotation?
pli-tv-pvr11:47.3: “Verdict in the presence of” or “verdict of past insanity” …
pli-tv-pvr11:47.4: “Verdict in the presence of” or “carrying out on his acknowledgement” …
pli-tv-pvr11:47.7: “Verdict in the presence of” or “covering over (as) with grass”—
pli-tv-pvr11:47.8: are these things different in meaning … or are they one in meaning and different only in connotation?
pli-tv-pvr11:47.9: “Verdict in the presence of” or “verdict of innocence”—
pli-tv-pvr11:47.10: these things are different in meaning as well as different in connotation.
pli-tv-pvr11:47.11: “Verdict in the presence of” or “verdict of past insanity” …
pli-tv-pvr11:47.15: “Verdict in the presence of” or “a covering over (as) with grass”—
pli-tv-pvr11:47.16: these things are different in meaning as well as different in connotation.
pli-tv-pvr11:48.1: (Can there be) a dispute and a legal question concerning disputes, a dispute but no legal question, a legal question but no dispute, a legal question as well as a dispute?
pli-tv-pvr11:48.2: There may be … (_see_ Kd.14.14.12–15 pli-tv-kd14:14.12.1 xkcd: segmenting is mildly different) …
pli-tv-pvr11:67.2: A legal question concerning obligations is a legal question as well as an obligation.
pli-tv-pvr11:68.1: Concluded is the Synopsis of Legal Questions
pli-tv-pvr11:71.6: this is in the Synopsis of Legal Questions.
